issue.title: [fmt] Update to 7.0.2 + [spdlog] Update to 1.7.0

labels.name: category:port-update
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is requesting update new revision

labels.name: info:needs-maintainer-attention
labels.description: Lets the current 'on rotation' vcpkg maintainer know they need to look at this.

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
- __What does your PR fix?__ Regular port update for [{fmt}](https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt/releases/tag/7.0.1)

- __Which triplets are supported/not supported? Have you updated the CI baseline?__
This causes a regression in `spdlog` because it uses the `fmt` implementation namespace, which was renamed from `internal` to `detail` in 7.0.0. I believe this can be resolved by defining the `FMT_USE_INTERNAL` macro according to the release notes, so I guess I should patch `spdlog` to add this define?

- __Does your PR follow the [maintainer guide](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/blob/master/docs/maintainers/maintainer-guide.md)?__ Yes

body:
Getting the same on Mageia Cauldron x86_64. Also using the same commit for fmt.

```
+ ctest --output-on-failure
Test project /mgarepo/fmt/deps/spdlog/BUILD/spdlog-1.6.1/build
    Start 1: spdlog-utests
1/1 Test #1: spdlog-utests ....................***Exception: SegFault  1.29 sec

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
spdlog-utests is a Catch v2.8.0 host application.
Run with -? for options

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
to_hex
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
../tests/test_misc.cpp:143
...............................................................................

../tests/test_misc.cpp:143: FAILED:
due to a fatal error condition:
  SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal

===============================================================================
test cases:  25 |  24 passed | 1 failed
assertions: 119 | 118 passed | 1 failed



0% tests passed, 1 tests failed out of 1

Total Test time (real) =   1.29 sec

The following tests FAILED:
	 1 - spdlog-utests (SEGFAULT)
Errors while running CTest
error: Bad exit status from /mgarepo/fmt/deps/spdlog/BUILDROOT/rpm-tmp.TBskk4 (%check)


RPM build errors:
    Bad exit status from /mgarepo/fmt/deps/spdlog/BUILDROOT/rpm-tmp.TBskk4 (%check)
error: failed!
```
Same problem with openSUSE Tumbleweed, see [log](https://github.com/gabime/spdlog/files/4890387/spdlog161_fmt7_tests.txt).
Can we get a stack trace from the coredump?

I see it uses /usr/include/fmt/core.h
Does this file belongs to fmt version 7.0?

> I see it uses /usr/include/fmt/core.h
> Does this file belongs to fmt version 7.0?

7.0.1 to be precise
Might be an issue with fmt.. @vitaut please advice

This is incorrect:

https://github.com/gabime/spdlog/blob/c62ba5f48db2520e7d2ddbaf14a88ab6f6991894/include/spdlog/fmt/bin_to_hex.h#L95

because it may dereference past the end of the format string (which is what happens). Should be something like

```c++
        while (it != ctx.end() && *it != '}')
```
@lgbaldoni could you please verify that latest commit  (19f280466195f347f3f2c474556a6be0b343a7fb) solves it?
I can confirm that it compiles successfully andthe test completes without errors.
I can also confirm the problem is solved.

I can confirm too.

Btw, @gabime can you push a new minor release with these fixes?
